subject: Law
title: Drug Crimes and Scheduling
description: A quick, practical guide to Drug Crimes and Scheduling.

hook.text: Cannabis is legal in some states but a federal Schedule I drugâ€”same category as heroin. The contradiction is real.

buildup.text: The Controlled Substances Act classifies drugs into five schedules based on abuse potential and medical use.

discovery.text: Schedule I means high abuse potential and no accepted medical use. Schedule V is the least restrictive.

twist.text: Critics say scheduling is politically driven. Cannabis remains Schedule I despite growing medical evidence.

climax.text: Drug crime penalties vary wildly by substance, quantity, and whether distribution is involved.

punchline.text: The schedule decides the sentence. Science doesn't always decide the schedule.

quiz.question: What does Schedule I classification mean?
options: High abuse potential, no accepted medical use
